channel.title: My First Sig
channel.description:
I was inspired by brownsymcard to try to make something in photoshop, and the first thing that popped up in my head to make was a Firefox image. This is what I came up with after trial and error:
[img]http://img250.imageshack.us/img250/9383/firstsigys2.png[/img]
With the Firefox text:
[img]http://img223.imageshack.us/img223/7676/firstsig2ly8.png[/img]
So tell me what you think, how I can improve, and anything else I can do to it. Remember, this is only my first try at photoshop :D.

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

I like the vibrant colors of the planet, but nothing flows. The contrast between the fox and blue around it is a bit too sharp and the BG doesn’t make any sense to me.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:10, topic:157816”]In this one, if you where to make it black and white, not gray and white, it would look better IMO. But there is so much you could have done with this. The colors of the fox and planet are wondrous, you could have emphasized these to create a magnificent image. For example:
Dulling down the orange until its almost gray, flowing blue to glow from the planet for a certain extent across the image, whilst dulling it as it gets further away. A very vibrant color and a decent amount of light and contrast would do wonders with this.[/quote]

I think I’m going to go with your idea and restart from scratch =].

EDIT:

Theres my next attempt at it l0l. Notice the darkened fox and lighting effect on the globe, + the small glow and trippy background =]. Suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:10, topic:157816”]In this one, if you where to make it black and white, not gray and white, it would look better IMO. But there is so much you could have done with this. The colors of the fox and planet are wondrous, you could have emphasized these to create a magnificent image. For example:
Dulling down the orange until its almost gray, flowing blue to glow from the planet for a certain extent across the image, whilst dulling it as it gets further away. A very vibrant color and a decent amount of light and contrast would do wonders with this.[/quote]

I gotta say, that would look marvelous. I love sigs that play with the colors.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I’m sorry RXVL, I said wrong, I meant to say to duplicate the symbol, and use the one below the copy and gaussian blur it.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

RXVL:

[img]http://img204.imageshack.us/img204/7854/firstsig3eg9.png[ /img]

In this one, if you where to make it black and white, not gray and white, it would look better IMO. But there is so much you could have done with this. The colors of the fox and planet are wondrous, you could have emphasized these to create a magnificent image. For example:
Dulling down the orange until its almost gray, flowing blue to glow from the planet for a certain extent across the image, whilst dulling it as it gets further away. A very vibrant color and a decent amount of light and contrast would do wonders with this.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

xxlegitxx:

I like the smoke better, but I think that next sig, you should choose a more appropriate render/background. The watercolor (?) look doesn’t go well with a sharp-looking, bright firefox logo.

What about the font?

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I like the smoke better, but I think that next sig, you should choose a more appropriate render/background. The watercolor (?) look doesn’t go well with a sharp-looking, bright firefox logo.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Ok, I got rid of the text, blurred the firefox logo, reduced the glow, and added the Gaussian Glow. Then I added in a splatter and blurred it so it looks like smoke. Now I have 2 different images to choose from, one with the smoke above the logo and one with the smoke below it. However, I still don’t know what to do with the text =.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

RXVL:

Can you suggest a good font because I can’t seem to find a good one anywhere.

There was actually a great list of fonts I found on digg/reddit a while back. Let me dig it up for you.

It’s so frustrating, because whenever I search for browser-safe fonts, I get fonts that are good for graphics, and when I search for fonts good with graphics, I get browser-safe fonts.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:2, topic:157816”]I’d like to see more integration here.

Instead of placing a render over a background, try blurring/smudging/etc to make the firefox icon look like it belongs. As for the RXVL… again, try to make it look like it belongs there. Don’t downplay it’s importance. Text is something that makes or breaks an image. Choose an appropriate font (it lookes like Times over there); trial and error will get you there. The text should really mesh with the rest of the image. [/quote]

Can you suggest a good font because I can’t seem to find a good one anywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

It doesn’t look good, what you did with the background is interesting. But this signature doesn’t accuratley represent firefox, and there is color, or simplicity, it’s grunge, which doesn’t show how robust FireFox is, and how amazing it is. I see you used an outer glow for the FireFox symbol, so you’re making FireFox the center of this piece. The text just doesn’t go with the grunge theme, and it’s to large. There is a lack of color except in the icon, try making the icon black and white. And instead of an outer glow, try a guasian blur. Also try some other text, and a border for the signature. Other than that you can’t improve this sig anymore. IF you were to remake it differently, I would make it with color, and possibly vector, with a simple white background, because FireFox’ interface is about simplicity.

3.87/10

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sig
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I’d like to see more integration here.

Instead of placing a render over a background, try blurring/smudging/etc to make the firefox icon look like it belongs. As for the RXVL… again, try to make it look like it belongs there. Don’t downplay it’s importance. Text is something that makes or breaks an image. Choose an appropriate font (it lookes like Times over there); trial and error will get you there. The text should really mesh with the rest of the image.

Read full topic
